revised_title: Intriguild Predation and Hedgehog Population Regulation
tldr: This study investigates the role of intraguild predation in regulating hedgehog populations. The author introduces hedgehogs into areas with and without badgers, a larger member of the same guild, and observes differences in mortality and dispersal. The results show that badgers significantly impact hedgehog survival, suggesting that intraguild predation plays a crucial role in shaping community structures.
